member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.WebConfigWriter
member.summary: Handles writing a Web.Config to disk that uses Url Authorization to prevent visitors from accessing the files directly. Alternative Web.config content can be specified, this is a general-purpose implementation. Uses UTF-8 encoding. Also provides methods for efficient verification that the file still exists. Thread-safe.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.WebConfigWriter.webConfigContents
member.summary: This string contains the contents of a web.conig file that sets URL authorization to "deny all" inside the current directory.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.WebConfigWriter.CheckWebConfigEvery5
member.summary: Verifies a Web.config file is present in the directory every 5 minutes that the function is called, including the first time.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.WebConfigWriter.CheckWebConfigOnce
member.summary: If CheckWebConfig has never executed, it is executed immediately, but only once. Verifies a Web.config file is present in the directory, and creates it if needed.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.WebConfigWriter.CheckWebConfig
member.summary: Verifies a Web.config file is present in the directory, and creates it if needed.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.WebConfigWriter._checkWebConfig
member.summary: Should only be called inside a lock. Creates the cache dir and the web.config file if they are missing. Updates _lastCheckedWebConfig and _checkedWebConfigOnce

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheQueryResult.Failed
member.summary: Failed to acquire a lock on the cached item within the timeout period

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheQueryResult.Miss
member.summary: The item wasn't cached, but was successfully added to the cache (or queued, in which case you should read .Data instead of .PhysicalPath)

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheQueryResult.Hit
member.summary: The item was already in the cache.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheResult.PhysicalPath
member.summary: The physical path to the cached item. Verify .Data is null before trying to read from this file.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheResult.Data
member.summary: Provides a read-only stream to the data. Usually a MemoryStream instance, but you should dispose it once you are done. If this value is not null, it indicates that the file has not yet been written to disk, and you should read it from this stream instead.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheResult.RelativePath
member.summary: The path relative to the cache

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheResult.Result
member.summary: The result of the cache check

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupManager.BeLazy
member.summary: Notifies the CleanupManager that a request is in process. Helps CleanupManager optimize background work so it doesn't interfere with request processing.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupManager.AddedFile(System.String)
member.summary: Notifies the CleanupManager that a file was added under the specified relative path. Allows CleanupManager to detect when a folder needs cleanup work.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupManager.ExteralProcessCleaning
member.summary: When true, indicates that another process is managing cleanup operations - this thread is idle, waiting for the other process to end before it can pick up work.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCacheException
member.summary: Indicates a problem with disk caching. Causes include a missing (or too small) ImageDiskCacheDir setting, and severe I/O locking preventing the cache dir from being cleaned at all.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache
member.summary: Provides methods for creating, maintaining, and securing the disk cache.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.BeforeSettingChanged
member.summary: Throws an exception if the class is already modified

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a disk cache in the /imagecache folder

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a DiskCache instance at the specified location. Must be installed as a plugin to be operational.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.LoadSettings(ImageResizer.Configuration.Config)
member.summary: Uses the defaults from the resizing.diskcache section in the specified configuration. Throws an invalid operation exception if the DiskCache is already started.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.Install(ImageResizer.Configuration.Config)
member.summary: Loads the settings from 'c', starts the cache, and registers the plugin. Will throw an invalidoperationexception if already started.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.IsConfigurationValid
member.summary: Returns true if the configured settings are valid and .NET (not NTFS) permissions will work.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.HasFileIOPermission
member.summary: Returns true if .NET permissions allow writing to the cache directory. Does not check NTFS permissions.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.Start
member.summary: Attempts to start the DiskCache using the current settings. Returns true if succesful or if already started. Returns false on a configuration error. Called by Install()

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.Stop
member.summary: Returns true if stopped succesfully. Cannot be restarted

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.Subfolders
member.summary: Controls how many subfolders to use for disk caching. Rounded to the next power of to. (1->2, 3->4, 5->8, 9->16, 17->32, 33->64, 65->128,129->256,etc.) NTFS does not handle more than 8,000 files per folder well. Larger folders also make cleanup more resource-intensive. Defaults to 32, which combined with the default setting of 400 images per folder, allows for scalability to 12,800 actively used image versions. For example, given a desired cache size of 100,000 items, this should be set to 256.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.Enabled
member.summary: Allows disk caching to be disabled for debuginng purposes. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.AutoClean
member.summary: If true, items from the cache folder will be automatically 'garbage collected' if the cache size limits are exceeded. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy
member.summary: Only relevant when AutoClean=true. Settings about how background cache cleanup are performed. It is best not to modify these settings. There are very complicated and non-obvious factors involved in their choice.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.CacheAccessTimeout
member.summary: How many milliseconds to wait for a cached item to be available. Values below 0 are set to 0. Defaults to 15 seconds. Actual time spent waiting may be 2 or 3x this value, if multiple layers of synchronization require a wait.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.HashModifiedDate
member.summary: If true, when a source file is changed, a new file will be created instead of overwriting the old cached file. This helps prevent file lock contention on high-traffic servers. Defaults to true. Do NOT set this to false in a Web Garden or if you have overlapped recycle enabled, as you may risk having occasional failed requests due to write contention by separate proccesses. Changes the hash function, so you should delete the cache folder whenever this setting is modified.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.AsyncWrites
member.summary: If true, writes to the disk cache will be performed outside the request thread, allowing responses to return to the client quicker.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.AsyncBufferSize
member.summary: If more than this amount of memory (in bytes) is currently allocated by queued writes, the request will be processed synchronously instead of asynchronously.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.VirtualCacheDir
member.summary: Sets the location of the cache directory. Can be a virtual path (like /App/imagecache) or an application-relative path (like ~/imagecache, the default). Relative paths are assummed to be relative to the application root. All values are converted to virtual path format upon assignment (/App/imagecache) Will throw an InvalidOperationException if changed after the plugin is installed.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.PhysicalCacheDir
member.summary: Returns the physical path of the cache directory specified in VirtualCacheDir.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.DiskCache.Started
member.summary: Returns true if the DiskCache instance is operational.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder
member.summary: Represents a cached view of a folder of cached items

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getCachedFileInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Returns null if (a) the file doesn't exist, or (b) the file isn't populated. Calling code should always fall back to filesystem calls on a null result.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.setCachedFileInfo(System.String,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFileInfo)
member.summary: Sets the CachedFileInfo object for the specified path, creating any needed folders along the way. If 'null', the item will be removed, and no missing folder will be created.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.bumpDateIfExists(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to set the AccessedUtc of the specified file to the current date (just in memory, not on the filesystem).

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getFileInfo(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a CachedFileInfo object for the file even if it isn't in the cache (falls back to the filesystem)

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getFileInfoCertainExists(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies the file exists before returning the cached data. Discrepancies in file existence result in OnFileDisappeard being fired.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.GetIsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of IsValid on the specified folder if present, or 'false' if not present.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Not thread safe.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getSubfolders(System.String)
member.summary: returns a list

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getSubfilesCopy(System.String)
member.summary: returns a dictionary of files.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.getSortedSubfiles(System.String)
member.summary: returns a dictionary of files.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.populate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes file and folder listing for this folder (non-recursive). Sets IsValid=true afterwards.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.populateSubfolders(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the 'folders' dictionary to match the folders that exist on disk. ONLY UPDATES THE LOCAL FOLDER

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.populateFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the 'files' dictionary to match the files that exist on disk. Uses the accessedUtc values from the previous dictionary if they are newer.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.roughCompare(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns true if both dates are equal to the nearest 200th of a second.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.IsValid
member.summary: Defaults to false. Set to true immediately after being refreshed from the filesystem. Set to false if a file disappears from the filesystem cache without the cache index being notified first. Used by the cleanup system - not of importance to the cache write system.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFolder.FileDisappeared
member.summary: Fired when a file disappears from the cache folder without the cache index knowing about it.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWriteCollection.Get(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: If the collection contains the specified item, it is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWriteCollection.GetQueuedBufferBytes
member.summary: Returns how many bytes are allocated by buffers in the queue. May be 2x the amount of data. Represents how much ram is being used by the queue, not the amount of encoded bytes that will actually be written.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWriteCollection.Remove(ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWrite)
member.summary: Removes the specified object based on its relativepath and modifieddateutc values.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWriteCollection.Queue(ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWrite,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWriteCollection.WriterDelegate)
member.summary: Returns false when (a) the specified AsyncWrite value already exists, (b) the queue is full, or (c) the thread pool queue is full

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWriteCollection.MaxQueueBytes
member.summary: How many bytes of buffered file data to hold in memory before refusing futher queue requests and forcing them to be executed synchronously.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.#ctor(ImageResizer.Configuration.Logging.ILoggerProvider,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Cleanup.CleanupQueue,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache)
member.summary: Creates and starts a thread that consumes the queue, pausing until notified when 'queue' empties.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.MayHaveWork
member.summary: Tells the worker to check the queue for more work.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.lastFoundItemsOverMax
member.summary: The last time a cache folder exceeded both the optimum and maximum limits for file count. If recent, indicates a misconfiguration; the subfolders="" count needs to be increased.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.lastBusy
member.summary: The last time a cache query came through

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.BeLazy
member.summary: Tells the worker to avoid work for a little bit.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.lastWorked
member.summary: The last time we did work (or attempted to do work, failing if the queue was empty)

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.otherProcessManagingCleanup
member.summary: When true, indicates that another process is managing cleanup operations - this thread is idle, waiting for the other process to end before it can pick up work.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.main
member.summary: Thread runs this method.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.mainInner
member.summary: Processes work items from the queue, using at most 50%

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.DoWorkFor(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Processes items from the queue for roughly the specified amount of time. Returns false if the queue was empty.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorker.ExteralProcessCleaning
member.summary: When true, indicates that another process is managing cleanup operations - this thread is idle, waiting for the other process to end before it can pick up work.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Cleanup.CleanupQueue.QueueIfUnique(ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem)
member.summary: Queues the item if no other identical items exist in the queue. Returns true if the item was added.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Cleanup.CleanupQueue.InsertRange(System.Collections.Generic.IList{ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem})
member.summary: Inserts the specified list of items and the end of the queue. They will be next items popped. They will pop off the list in the same order they exist in 'items' (i.e, they are inserted in reverse order).

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Cleanup.CleanupQueue.ReplaceWith(ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem)
member.summary: Performs an atomic clear and enqueue of the specified item

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheIndex
member.summary: Provides thread-safe access to the index of the disk cache

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.StartupDelay
member.summary: How long to wait before beginning the initial cache indexing and cleanup.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.MinDelay
member.summary: The minimum amount of time to wait after the most recent BeLazy to begin working again.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.MaxDelay
member.summary: The maximum amount of time to wait between work segements

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.OptimalWorkSegmentLength
member.summary: The optimal length for a work segment. Not always achieved.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.TargetItemsPerFolder
member.summary: The ideal number of cached files per folder. (defaults to 400) Only reached if it can be achieved without volating the AvoidRemoval... limits

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.MaximumItemsPerFolder
member.summary: The maximum number of cached files per folder. (defaults to 1000) Only reached if it can be achieved without violating the ProhibitRemoval... limits

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.AvoidRemovalIfUsedWithin
member.summary: Please note "LastUsed" values are (initially) only accurate to about a hour, due to delayed write. If a file has been used after the app started running, the the last used date is accurate.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupStrategy.ProhibitRemovalIfUsedWithin
member.summary: Please note "LastUsed" values are (initially) only accurate to about a hour, due to delayed write. If a file has been used after the app started running, the the last used date is accurate.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache
member.summary: Handles access to a disk-based file cache. Handles locking and versioning. Supports subfolders for scalability.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.GetCachedFile(System.String,System.String,ImageResizer.Caching.ResizeImageDelegate,System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: If the cached data exists and is up-to-date, returns the path to it. Otherwise, this function tries to cache the data and return the path.
member.param: The basis for the key. Should not include the modified date, that is handled inside the function.
The extension to use for the cached file.
A method that accepts a Stream argument and writes the data to it.
The modified date of the source file. Should be DateTime.MinValue if not available

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.GetCachedFile(System.String,System.String,ImageResizer.Caching.ResizeImageDelegate,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: May return either a physical file name or a MemoryStream with the data. Faster than GetCachedFile, as writes are (usually) asynchronous. If the write queue is full, the write is forced to be synchronous again. Identical to GetCachedFile() when async=false

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.TryWriteFile(ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CacheResult,System.String,System.String,ImageResizer.Caching.ResizeImageDelegate,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if either (a) the file was written, or (b) the file already existed with a matching modified date. Returns false if the in-process lock failed. Throws an exception if any kind of file or processing exception occurs.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.CacheResultReturned
member.summary: Fired immediately before GetCachedFile return the result value.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.Locks
member.summary: Provides string-based locking for file write access.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.QueueLocks
member.summary: Provides string-based locking for image resizing (not writing, just processing). Prevents duplication of efforts in async mode, where 'Locks' is not being used.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.CurrentWrites
member.summary: Contains all the queued and in-progress writes to the cache.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CustomDiskCache.Index
member.summary: Provides an in-memory index of the cache.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.LockProvider
member.summary: Provides locking based on a string key. Locks are local to the LockProvider instance. The class handles disposing of unused locks. Generally used for coordinating writes to files (of which there can be millions). Only keeps key/lock pairs in memory which are in use. Thread-safe.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.LockProvider.locks
member.summary: The only objects in this collection should be for open files.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.LockProvider.createLock
member.summary: Synchronization object for modifications to the 'locks' dictionary

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.LockProvider.TryExecute(System.String,System.Int32,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.LockCallback)
member.summary: Attempts to execute the 'success' callback inside a lock based on 'key'. If successful, returns true. If the lock cannot be acquired within 'timoutMs', returns false In a worst-case scenario, it could take up to twice as long as 'timeoutMs' to return false.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem
member.summary: An item in the work queue

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.LazyProvider
member.summary: Should be a delegate a CleanupWorkItem instance (which doesn't have LazyProvider value, but has RelativePath and PhyscialPath values). May return null

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.RelativePath
member.summary: Cache-relative path

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.PhysicalPath
member.summary: Physcial path

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.Kind.PopulateFolderRecursive
member.summary: If the .IsValid is false, populates the folder, enqueing more PopulateFolderRecursive items for all subfolders discovered. Sets IsValid to true

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.Kind.CleanFolderRecursive
member.summary: Requires a valid folder.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.Kind.CleanFolder
member.summary: Cleans the folder, enqueing RemoveFile tasks for everything that needs to be removed.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.Kind.PopulateFolder
member.summary: Populates (non-recursive) the files and folders inside the specified directory.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.Kind.RemoveFile
member.summary: Removes a single file, with the file and dir being determined at executing time via the LazyProvider delegate.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CleanupWorkItem.Kind.FlushAccessedDate
member.summary: Calls File.SetLastAccessedTimeUtc() using the in-memory value, if present.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFileInfo.#ctor(System.IO.FileInfo,ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFileInfo)
member.summary: Uses old.AccessedUtc if it is newer than FileInfo.LastAccessTimeUtc

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFileInfo.ModifiedUtc
member.summary: The modified date of the source file that the cached file is based on.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFileInfo.AccessedUtc
member.summary: The last time the file was accessed. Will not match NTFS date, this value is updated by DiskCache. When first loaded from NTFS, it will be granular to about an hour, due to NTFS delayed write. Also, windows Vista and higher never write accessed dates. We update this value in memory, and flush it to disk lazily.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.CachedFileInfo.UpdatedUtc
member.summary: The Created date of the cached file - the last time the cached file was written to

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWrite.GetReadonlyStream
member.summary: Wraps the data in a readonly MemoryStream so it can be accessed on another thread

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.DiskCache.Async.AsyncWrite.JobCreatedAt
member.summary: Returns the UTC time this AsyncWrite object was created.
